page.title: 18CHURCHDOWN LAND DEVELOPMENT
page.content: There has been a large amount of Land Development in Churchdown in the last few years,including the building of several new housing estates in and around the village.The first new houses have appeared opposite Chosen Hill School,in Brookfield Road,on a piece of land which used to be an orchard.The other main site is situated near Churchdown Junior School. The building of a Motorway(M5) in 1968 has also affected land use around it.When the Motorway was built the topsoil was taken off the surrounding fields and rubbish from the Motorway was dumped into the fields.Because of this the land is just used for grazing beef cattle.The grass on the other side of Motorway however,is still used for dairy cattle.
